imagePullSecrets.description: Global Docker registry secret names as an array

nameOverride.description: String to partially override external-dns.fullname template (will maintain the release name)

fullnameOverride.description: String to fully override external-dns.fullname template

commonLabels.description: Labels to add to all deployed objects

commonAnnotations.description: Annotations to add to all deployed objects

extraDeploy.description: Array of extra objects to deploy with the release (evaluated as a template).

kubeVersion.description: Force target Kubernetes version (using Helm capabilities if not set)

watchReleaseNamespace.description: Watch only namepsace used for the release

tag.description: ExternalDNS Image tag (immutable tags are recommended)

digest.description: ExternalDNS image digest in the way sha256:aa.... Please note this parameter, if set, will override the tag

sources.description: K8s resources type to be observed for new DNS entries by ExternalDNS

provider.description: DNS provider where the DNS records will be created.

initContainers.description: Attach additional init containers to the pod (evaluated as a template)

sidecars.description: Attach additional containers to the pod (evaluated as a template)

namespace.description: Limit sources of endpoints to a specific namespace (default: all namespaces)

fqdnTemplates.description: Templated strings that are used to generate DNS names from sources that don't define a hostname themselves

combineFQDNAnnotation.description: Combine FQDN template and annotations instead of overwriting

ignoreHostnameAnnotation.description: Ignore hostname annotation when generating DNS names, valid only when fqdn-template is set

publishInternalServices.description: Allow external-dns to publish DNS records for ClusterIP services

publishHostIP.description: Allow external-dns to publish host-ip for headless services

serviceTypeFilter.description: The service types to take care about (default: all, options: ClusterIP, NodePort, LoadBalancer, ExternalName)

host.description: Hostname to use for EdgeGrid auth

accessToken.description: Access Token to use for EdgeGrid auth

clientToken.description: Client Token to use for EdgeGrid auth

clientSecret.description: When using the Akamai provider, `AKAMAI_CLIENT_SECRET` to set (optional)

secretName.description: Use an existing secret with key "akamai_api_seret" defined.

accessKeyId.description: When using the Alibaba Cloud provider, set `accessKeyId` in the Alibaba Cloud configuration file (optional)

accessKeySecret.description: When using the Alibaba Cloud provider, set `accessKeySecret` in the Alibaba Cloud configuration file (optional)

regionId.description: When using the Alibaba Cloud provider, set `regionId` in the Alibaba Cloud configuration file (optional)

secretName.description: Use an existing secret with key "alibaba-cloud.json" defined.

zoneType.description: Zone Filter. Available values are: public, private, or no value for both

secretKey.description: When using the AWS provider, set `aws_secret_access_key` in the AWS credentials (optional)

accessKey.description: When using the AWS provider, set `aws_access_key_id` in the AWS credentials (optional)

mountPath.description: When using the AWS provider, determine `mountPath` for `credentials` secret

secretName.description: Use an existing secret with key "credentials" defined.

name.description: Define the name of the secret that stores aws_access_key_id.

key.description: Define the key of the secret that stores aws_access_key_id.

name.description: Define the name of the secret that stores aws_secret_access_key

key.description: Define the key of the secret that stores aws_secret_access_key

region.description: When using the AWS provider, `AWS_DEFAULT_REGION` to set in the environment (optional)

zoneType.description: When using the AWS provider, filter for zones of this type (optional, options: public, private)

assumeRoleArn.description: When using the AWS provider, assume role by specifying --aws-assume-role to the external-dns daemon

roleArn.description: Specify role ARN to the external-dns daemon

apiRetries.description: Maximum number of retries for AWS API calls before giving up

batchChangeSize.description: When using the AWS provider, set the maximum number of changes that will be applied in each batch

zonesCacheDuration.description: If the list of Route53 zones managed by ExternalDNS doesn't change frequently, cache it by setting a TTL

zoneTags.description: When using the AWS provider, filter for zones with these tags

preferCNAME.description: When using the AWS provider, replaces Alias records with CNAME (options: true, false)

evaluateTargetHealth.description: When using the AWS provider, sets the evaluate target health flag (options: true, false)

secretName.description: When using the Azure provider, set the secret containing the `azure.json` file

cloud.description: When using the Azure provider, set the Azure Cloud

resourceGroup.description: When using the Azure provider, set the Azure Resource Group

tenantId.description: When using the Azure provider, set the Azure Tenant ID

subscriptionId.description: When using the Azure provider, set the Azure Subscription ID

aadClientId.description: When using the Azure provider, set the Azure AAD Client ID

aadClientSecret.description: When using the Azure provider, set the Azure AAD Client Secret

useWorkloadIdentityExtension.description: When using the Azure provider, set if you use Workload Identity extension.

useManagedIdentityExtension.description: When using the Azure provider, set if you use Azure MSI

userAssignedIdentityID.description: When using the Azure provider with Azure MSI, set Client ID of Azure user-assigned managed identity (optional, otherwise system-assigned managed identity is used)

apiToken.description: When using the Cloudflare provider, `CF_API_TOKEN` to set (optional)

apiKey.description: When using the Cloudflare provider, `CF_API_KEY` to set (optional)

secretName.description: When using the Cloudflare provider, it's the name of the secret containing cloudflare_api_token or cloudflare_api_key.

email.description: When using the Cloudflare provider, `CF_API_EMAIL` to set (optional). Needed when using CF_API_KEY

proxied.description: When using the Cloudflare provider, enable the proxy feature (DDOS protection, CDN...) (optional)

etcdEndpoints.description: When using the CoreDNS provider, set etcd backend endpoints (comma-separated list)

enabled.description: When using the CoreDNS provider, enable secure communication with etcd

secretName.description: When using the CoreDNS provider, specify a name of existing Secret with etcd certs and keys

mountPath.description: When using the CoreDNS provider, set destination dir to mount data from `coredns.etcdTLS.secretName` to

caFilename.description: When using the CoreDNS provider, specify CA PEM file name from the `coredns.etcdTLS.secretName`

certFilename.description: When using the CoreDNS provider, specify cert PEM file name from the `coredns.etcdTLS.secretName`

keyFilename.description: When using the CoreDNS provider, specify private key PEM file name from the `coredns.etcdTLS.secretName`

username.description: When using the Designate provider, specify the OpenStack authentication username. (optional)

password.description: When using the Designate provider, specify the OpenStack authentication password. (optional)

applicationCredentialId.description: When using the Designate provider, specify the OpenStack authentication application credential ID. This conflicts with `designate.username`. (optional)

applicationCredentialSecret.description: When using the Designate provider, specify the OpenStack authentication application credential ID. This conflicts with `designate.password`. (optional)

authUrl.description: When using the Designate provider, specify the OpenStack authentication Url. (optional)

regionName.description: When using the Designate provider, specify the OpenStack region name. (optional)

userDomainName.description: When using the Designate provider, specify the OpenStack user domain name. (optional)

projectName.description: When using the Designate provider, specify the OpenStack project name. (optional)

authType.description: When using the Designate provider, specify the OpenStack auth type. (optional)

customCAHostPath.description: When using the Designate provider, use a CA file already on the host to validate Openstack APIs.  This conflicts with `designate.customCA.enabled`

enabled.description: When using the Designate provider, enable a custom CA (optional)

content.description: When using the Designate provider, set the content of the custom CA

mountPath.description: When using the Designate provider, set the mountPath in which to mount the custom CA configuration

filename.description: When using the Designate provider, set the custom CA configuration filename

apiKey.description: When using the Exoscale provider, `EXTERNAL_DNS_EXOSCALE_APIKEY` to set (optional)

apiToken.description: When using the Exoscale provider, `EXTERNAL_DNS_EXOSCALE_APISECRET` to set (optional)

secretName.description: Use an existing secret with keys "exoscale_api_key" and "exoscale_api_token" defined.

apiToken.description: When using the DigitalOcean provider, `DO_TOKEN` to set (optional)

secretName.description: Use an existing secret with key "digitalocean_api_token" defined.

project.description: When using the Google provider, specify the Google project (required when provider=google)

batchChangeSize.description: When using the google provider, set the maximum number of changes that will be applied in each batch

serviceAccountSecret.description: When using the Google provider, specify the existing secret which contains credentials.json (optional)

serviceAccountSecretKey.description: When using the Google provider with an existing secret, specify the key name (optional)

serviceAccountKey.description: When using the Google provider, specify the service account key JSON file. In this case a new secret will be created holding this service account (optional)

zoneVisibility.description: When using the Google provider, fiter for zones of a specific visibility (private or public)

token.description: When using the Hetzner provider, specify your token here. (required when `hetzner.secretName` is not provided. In this case a new secret will be created holding the token.)

secretName.description: When using the Hetzner provider, specify the existing secret which contains your token. Disables the usage of `hetzner.token` (optional)

secretKey.description: When using the Hetzner provider with an existing secret, specify the key name (optional)

wapiUsername.description: When using the Infoblox provider, specify the Infoblox WAPI username

wapiPassword.description: When using the Infoblox provider, specify the Infoblox WAPI password (required when provider=infoblox)

gridHost.description: When using the Infoblox provider, specify the Infoblox Grid host (required when provider=infoblox)

secretName.description: Existing secret name, when in place wapiUsername and wapiPassword are not required

domainFilter.description: When using the Infoblox provider, specify the domain (optional)

nameRegex.description: When using the Infoblox provider, specify the name regex filter (optional)

noSslVerify.description: When using the Infoblox provider, disable SSL verification (optional)

wapiPort.description: When using the Infoblox provider, specify the Infoblox WAPI port (optional)

wapiVersion.description: When using the Infoblox provider, specify the Infoblox WAPI version (optional)

wapiConnectionPoolSize.description: When using the Infoblox provider, specify the Infoblox WAPI request connection pool size (optional)

wapiHttpTimeout.description: When using the Infoblox provider, specify the Infoblox WAPI request timeout in seconds (optional)

maxResults.description: When using the Infoblox provider, specify the Infoblox Max Results (optional)

apiToken.description: When using the Linode provider, `LINODE_TOKEN` to set (optional)

secretName.description: Use an existing secret with key "linode_api_token" defined.

minTTL.description: When using the ns1 provider, specify minimal TTL, as an integer, for records

apiKey.description: When using the ns1 provider, specify the API key to use

secretName.description: Use an existing secret with key "ns1-api-key" defined.

region.description: When using the OCI provider, specify the region, where your zone is located in.

tenancyOCID.description: When using the OCI provider, specify your Tenancy OCID

userOCID.description: When using the OCI provider, specify your User OCID

compartmentOCID.description: When using the OCI provider, specify your Compartment OCID where your DNS Zone is located in.

privateKey.description: When using the OCI provider, paste in your RSA private key file for the Oracle API
privateKey.default:
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----

privateKeyFingerprint.description: When using the OCI provider, put in the fingerprint of your privateKey

privateKeyPassphrase.description: When using the OCI provider and your privateKey has a passphrase, put it in here. (optional)

secretName.description: When using the OCI provider, it's the name of the secret containing `oci.yaml` file.

consumerKey.description: When using the OVH provider, specify the existing consumer key. (required when provider=ovh and `ovh.secretName` is not provided.)

applicationKey.description: When using the OVH provider with an existing application, specify the application key. (required when provider=ovh and `ovh.secretName` is not provided.)

applicationSecret.description: When using the OVH provider with an existing application, specify the application secret. (required when provider=ovh and `ovh.secretName` is not provided.)

secretName.description: When using the OVH provider, it's the name of the secret containing `ovh_consumer_key`, `ovh_application_key` and `ovh_application_secret`. Disables usage of other `ovh`.

scwAccessKey.description: When using the Scaleway provider, specify an existing access key. (required when provider=scaleway)

scwSecretKey.description: When using the Scaleway provider, specify an existing secret key. (required when provider=scaleway)

host.description: When using the rfc2136 provider, specify the RFC2136 host (required when provider=rfc2136)

port.description: When using the rfc2136 provider, specify the RFC2136 port (optional)

zone.description: When using the rfc2136 provider, specify the zone (required when provider=rfc2136)

tsigSecret.description: When using the rfc2136 provider, specify the tsig secret to enable security. (do not specify if `rfc2136.secretName` is provided.) (optional)

secretName.description: When using the rfc2136 provider, specify the existing secret which contains your tsig secret in the key "rfc2136_tsig_secret". Disables the usage of `rfc2136.tsigSecret` (optional)

tsigSecretAlg.description: When using the rfc2136 provider, specify the tsig secret to enable security (optional)

tsigKeyname.description: When using the rfc2136 provider, specify the tsig keyname to enable security (optional)

tsigAxfr.description: When using the rfc2136 provider, enable AFXR to enable security (optional)

minTTL.description: When using the rfc2136 provider, specify minimal TTL (in duration format) for records[ns, us, ms, s, m, h], see more <https://golang.org/pkg/time/#ParseDuration>

rfc3645Enabled.description: When using the rfc2136 provider, extend using RFC3645 to support secure updates over Kerberos with GSS-TSIG

kerberosConfig.description: When using the rfc2136 provider with rfc3645Enabled, the contents of a configuration file for krb5 (optional)

kerberosUsername.description: When using the rfc2136 provider with rfc3645Enabled, specify the username to authenticate with (optional)

kerberosPassword.description: When using the rfc2136 provider with rfc3645Enabled, specify the password to authenticate with (optional)

kerberosRealm.description: When using the rfc2136 provider with rfc3645Enabled, specify the realm to authenticate to (required when provider=rfc2136 and rfc2136.rfc3645Enabled=true)

apiUrl.description: When using the PowerDNS provider, specify the API URL of the server.

apiPort.description: When using the PowerDNS provider, specify the API port of the server.

apiKey.description: When using the PowerDNS provider, specify the API key of the server.

secretName.description: When using the PowerDNS provider, specify as secret name containing the API Key

account.description: When using the TransIP provider, specify the account name.

apiKey.description: When using the TransIP provider, specify the API key to use.

host.description: When using the VinylDNS provider, specify the VinylDNS API host.

accessKey.description: When using the VinylDNS provider, specify the Access Key to use.

secretKey.description: When using the VinylDNS provider, specify the Secret key to use.

domainFilters.description: Limit possible target zones by domain suffixes (optional)

regexDomainFilter.description: Limit possible target zones by regex domain suffixes (optional)

regexDomainExclusion.description: Exclude subdomains by using regex pattern (optional)

zoneNameFilters.description: Filter target zones by zone domain (optional)

zoneIdFilters.description: Limit possible target zones by zone id (optional)

annotationFilter.description: Filter sources managed by external-dns via annotation using label selector (optional)

labelFilter.description: Select sources managed by external-dns using label selector (optional)

ingressClassFilters.description: Filter sources managed by external-dns via IngressClass (optional)

managedRecordTypesFilters.description: Filter record types managed by external-dns (optional)

dryRun.description: When enabled, prints DNS record changes rather than actually performing them (optional)

triggerLoopOnEvent.description: When enabled, triggers run loop on create/update/delete events in addition to regular interval (optional)

logLevel.description: Verbosity of the logs (options: panic, debug, info, warning, error, fatal, trace)

logFormat.description: Which format to output logs in (options: text, json)

policy.description: Modify how DNS records are synchronized between sources and providers (options: sync, upsert-only )

registry.description: Registry method to use (options: txt, aws-sd, noop)

txtPrefix.description: When using the TXT registry, a prefix for ownership records that avoids collision with CNAME entries (optional)<CNAME record> (Mutual exclusive with txt-suffix)

txtSuffix.description: When using the TXT registry, a suffix for ownership records that avoids collision with CNAME entries (optional)<CNAME record>.suffix (Mutual exclusive with txt-prefix)

txtOwnerId.description: A name that identifies this instance of ExternalDNS. Currently used by registry types: txt & aws-sd (optional)

forceTxtOwnerId.description: (backward compatibility) When using the non-TXT registry, it will pass the value defined by `txtOwnerId` down to the application (optional)

extraArgs.description: Extra arguments to be passed to external-dns

extraEnvVars.description: An array to add extra env vars

extraEnvVarsSecret.description: Secret containing extra env vars (in case of sensitive data)

topologySpreadConstraints.description: Topology Spread Constraints for pod assignment

podAffinityPreset.description: Pod affinity preset. Ignored if `affinity` is set. Allowed values: `soft` or `hard`

podAntiAffinityPreset.description: Pod anti-affinity preset. Ignored if `affinity` is set. Allowed values: `soft` or `hard`

type.description: Node affinity preset type. Ignored if `affinity` is set. Allowed values: `soft` or `hard`

key.description: Node label key to match Ignored if `affinity` is set.

values.description: Node label values to match. Ignored if `affinity` is set.

podAnnotations.description: Additional annotations to apply to the pod.

podLabels.description: Additional labels to be added to pods

secretAnnotations.description: Additional annotations to apply to the secret

create.description: Install and use the integrated DNSEndpoint CRD

apiversion.description: Sets the API version for the CRD to watch

kind.description: Sets the kind for the CRD to watch

enabled.description: Whether to create Service resource or not

http.description: Port to bind to for NodePort service type (client port)

clusterIP.description: IP address to assign to service

loadBalancerIP.description: IP address to assign to load balancer (if supported)

loadBalancerSourceRanges.description: List of IP CIDRs allowed access to load balancer (if supported)

extraPorts.description: Extra ports to expose in the service (normally used with the `sidecar` value)

labels.description: Provide any additional labels which may be required.

sessionAffinity.description: Session Affinity for Kubernetes service, can be "None" or "ClientIP"

create.description: Determine whether a Service Account should be created or it should reuse a exiting one.

name.description: ServiceAccount to use. A name is generated using the external-dns.fullname template if it is not set

automountServiceAccountToken.description: Automount API credentials for a service account.

create.description: Whether to create & use RBAC resources or not

clusterRole.description: Whether to create Cluster Role. When set to false creates a Role in `namespace`

pspEnabled.description: Whether to create a PodSecurityPolicy. WARNING: PodSecurityPolicy is deprecated in Kubernetes v1.21 or later, unavailable in v1.25 or later

limits.description: The resources limits for the container

requests.description: The requested resources for the container

extraVolumes.description: A list of volumes to be added to the pod

extraVolumeMounts.description: A list of volume mounts to be added to the pod

enabled.description: Enable prometheus to access external-dns metrics endpoint

podAnnotations.description: Annotations for enabling prometheus to access the metrics endpoint

namespace.description: Namespace in which Prometheus is running

interval.description: Interval at which metrics should be scraped

scrapeTimeout.description: Timeout after which the scrape is ended

metricRelabelings.description: Specify Metric Relabelings to add to the scrape endpoint

honorLabels.description: Specify honorLabels parameter to add the scrape endpoint

labels.description: Used to pass Labels that are required by the installed Prometheus Operator

jobLabel.description: The name of the label on the target service to use as the job name in prometheus.

enabled.description: Create Google Managed Prometheus PodMonitoring object

interval.description: Interval at which metrics should be scraped by Google Managed Prometheus

endpoint.description: The endpoint for Google Managed Prometheus scraping the metrics
